unicode.value: Your home
Angela María Rodriguez Revidiego

Este REA, está pensado para un Plan Educativo de Idioma Extranjero Inglés, nivel medio. Está formado por contenidos y actividades interactivas, que tratan todas las destrezas de habla inglesa, sobre el tema Your home.

 img[style*="float: right"] { margin-left: 10px;margin-bottom: 5px;}
 img[style*="float:right"] { margin-left: 10px;margin-bottom: 5px;}
 div.tabla-centro {overflow-x: auto; justify-content: center;}
 div.tabla {display: table; margin: 0 auto; padding: 0;table-layout: fixed;align-self: center;}
 div.tabla-fila {display: table-row; margin: 0; padding: 0;}
 div.tabla-celda {display: table-cell; margin: 0; padding: 1px; border: 1px solid #000; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;}
 div.tabla-celdaSinBorde {display: table-cell; margin: 0; padding: 3px; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle;}

 div.creditos figure {text-align: center;}
 div.creditos img {max-width: 170px !important;max-height: 200px !important;border: 2px solid black;border-radius: 4px;background-color: white;}
 div.creditos figcaption {width: 170px;text-align: left;margin: 0 auto;white-space: pre-line; word-wrap: break-word;}

 img.bocadillo {box-sizing: content-box;border: 1px solid #f1d031;border-radius: 5px;background-color: white;}

 div.inputResponsive input {width:65% !important;}

master class
closed exercise or problem
real project
didactic game
open problem
conceptual map
guided reading
Educación Permanente
Primera lengua extranjera
Your home
Text and Tasks
1. Your city

DICTIONARY

Encourage

Definition:

When you advise someone to do something with enthusiasm.

Cuando le aconsejas a alguien que haga algo con entusiasmo.

Example:

The teacher encourages her students with prizes.

La profesora anima a sus alumnos con premios.

Spanish word:

Animar

Audio:

Host

Definition:

Person who has guests at home.

Persona que tiene invitados en casa.

Example:

A good host takes care of all the details of a party.

Un buen anfitrión se encarga de todos los detalles de una fiesta.

Spanish word:

Anfitrión

Audio:

 



Leaflet

Definition:

Piece of paper with some kind of information on it.

Trozo de papel con algún tipo de información en él.

Example:

All attendees of the exhibition received a leaflet.

Todos los asistentes a la exposición recibieron un folleto.

Spanish word:

Folleto

Audio:


 

Meet

Definition:

To see and talk to someone for the first time.

Ver y saludar a alguien por primera vez.

Example:

I meet new people every weekend. 

Conozco gente nueva cada fin de semana.

Spanish word:

Conocer

Audio:


 

Treasure

Definition:

Valuables stored in a site.

Objetos de valor guardados en un sitio.

Example:

Life is a treasure.

La vida es un tesoro.

Spanish word:

Tesoro

Audio:
Text and Tasks
1. Come on in!

Welcome to my home REA Andalucía!

Here I live together with the REA team. 

I'm sure you live in a wonderful place!

Imagine another student visiting you.

Could you suggest places to go?

Which people to meet?

Which monuments to visit?

I'm sure you would be a great host!

I encourage you to create a fantastic presentation of the place where you live.

Arouse the interest of your visitors!

Encourage

Definition:

When you advise someone to do something with enthusiasm.

Cuando le aconsejas a alguien que haga algo con entusiasmo.

Example:

The teacher encourages her students with prizes.

La profesora anima a sus alumnos con premios.

Spanish word:

Animar

Host

Definition:

Person who has guests at home.

Persona que tiene invitados en casa.

Example:

A good host takes care of all the details of a party.

Un buen anfitrión se encarga de todos los detalles de una fiesta.

Spanish word:

Anfitrión

Meet

Definition:

To see and talk to someone for the first time.

Ver y saludar a alguien por primera vez.

Example:

I meet new people every weekend. 

Conozco gente nueva cada fin de semana.

Spanish word:

Conocer


Contenido.

Lectura facilitada

Easy to read

READ

Imagine another student visiting you.

Imagina que te visita otro estudiante.

Visiting is when you go to someone's home.

Visitar es cuando vas a la casa de alguien.

Think of things to show the student.

Piensa en cosas para enseñar al estudiante.

For example:

Por ejemplo:

1. Nice places to go.

1. Lugares bonitos donde ir.

2. Interesting people to meet.

2. Personas interesantes que conocer.

3. Monuments to see.

3. Monumentos para ver.

You can be a great host.

Tú puedes ser un gran anfitrión.

A host is a person who has guests at home.

Un anfitrión es la persona que tiene invitados en casa.

Audio

Question 1:

     Can you tell me the name of your hometown?

Question 2:

    Which place is most popular in your city/town?

Question 3:

    Does your town or city have any significant landmarks?

Question 4:

        Where do you like to hang out with your friends?

Question 5:

  Is there anyone famous or influential from your city or town?
Text and Tasks
2. Test your general knowledge

DICTIONARY

Festivities

Definition:

It is an event that is part of a celebration.

Es un evento que forma parte de una celebración.

Example:

Halloween and Christmas are the funniest festivities of the year.

Halloween y Navidades son las fiestas más divertidas del año.

Spanish word:

Fiestas

Audio:

 

 

Tour guide

Definition:

It is the person who accompanies tourists on visits to a place.

Es la persona que acompaña a los turistas en las visitas a un lugar.

Example:

Our tour guide knew the best corners of the town.

Nuestro guía turístico conocía los mejores rincones del pueblo.

Spanish word:

Guía turístico

Audio:

 

 

Wonder (noun)

Definition:

Extraordinary quality of someone or something that causes admiration.

Cualidad extraordinaria de alguien o algo que causa admiración.

Example:

My robot can do wonders.

Mi robot puede hacer maravillas.

Spanish word:

Maravilla (nombre)

Audio:
Text and Tasks
1. Your home

Hi guys! 

Show other children where you live and the wonders of your place.

In groups of 4, relate monuments, places, important people and festivities with different photos.

Use the cooperative strategy “I see, I think and I wonder” to work with your classmates.

Festivities

Definition:

Is an event that is part of a celebration.

Es un evento que forma parte de una celebración.

Example:

Halloween and Christmas are the funniest festivities of the year.

Halloween y Navidades son las fiestas más divertidas del año.

Spanish word:

Fiestas

Wonder (noun)

Definition:

Extraordinary quality of someone or something that causes admiration.

Cualidad extraordinaria de alguien o algo que causa admiración.

Example:

My robot can do wonders.

Mi robot puede hacer maravillas.

Spanish word:

Maravilla (nombre)

Contenido.

Lectura facilitada

Easy to read

Read

Show the beautiful things about the place where you live.

Muestra las cosas bonitas del lugar dónde vives.

Work in groups of 4 people.

Trabaja en grupos de 4 personas.

First look at the photos about:

Primero mira las fotos sobre:

Monuments.

Monumentos.

Places of interest.

Lugares de interés.

Famous people.

Personas famosas.

Festivities.

Festividades.

A festivity is a celebration of something.

Una festividad es una celebración de algo.

For example, Halloween.

Por ejemplo Halloween.

Then complete the document.

Después completa el documento.

Use the strategy I see, I think, I wonder.

Usa la estrategia veo, pienso y me pregunto.

Audio

Monuments

Places

Important characters

Festivities
Text and Tasks
3. Interesting Places

DICTIONARY

Send

Definition:

Getting something to a place, especially by post or email.

Hacer que algo llegue a un lugar, especialmente por correo postal o electrónico.

Example:

You can send the documents to the school by email.

Puedes enviar los documentos al colegio por email.

Spanish word:

Enviar

Audio:
Text and Tasks
1. introduction

In your leaflet you will have to write about interesting aspects of the place where you live. 

I will help you find and organise them. 

Watch the video.

What elements of the video can you use to describe your place?

Contenido.

Lectura facilitada

Easy to read

Read

Watch the video carefully.

Mira con atención el vídeo.

It will help you to write about your place in your leaflet.

Te ayudará a escribir sobre tu lugar en tu folleto.

What monuments, places of interest and festivities there are.

Como qué monumentos, lugares de interés y festividades hay.

Audio

Click here to access the subtitles of the video

Do you want help sorting your new vocabulary?

Click here to download the document “Culture: glossary of terms”.

¿Necesitas ayuda para organizar el nuevo vocabulario?

Aprender muchas palabras nuevas es a veces difícil. Organizarlas puede ayudarnos a recordarlas. 

Aquí tienes un glosario de palabras que te ayudará.

Haga clic aquí para descargar el documento "Cultura: glosario de términos".
Text and Tasks
2. Apply what you’ve learned

It's time to show what you know. 

Choose the option you prefer and show your skills with the cultural aspects you have learnt. 

Go for it!

Contenido.

Lectura facilitada

Easy to read

Read

Show what you know about aspects of culture.

Demuestra lo que tú sabes sobre aspectos de la cultura.

Work on your own.

 Trabaja tú solo o sola.

Choose the option you prefer.

Elige la opción que prefieras.

Audio
Text and Tasks
Section A
Enter the available choices here. You can add options by clicking the "Add Another Option" button. Delete options by clicking the red "X" next to the Option.
University of Auckland

Type in the feedback that you want the student to see when selecting the particular option. If you don't complete this box, eXe will automatically provide default feedback as follows: "Correct answer" as indicated by the selection for the correct answer; or "Wrong answer" for the other options.
Enter a hint here. If you do not want to provide a hint, leave this field blank.
Select the correct option by clicking on the radio button.

Although more often used in formal testing situations MCQs can be used as a testing tool to stimulate thought and discussion on topics students may feel a little reticent in responding to. When designing a MCQ test consider the following:
  • What learning outcomes are the questions testing
  • What intellectual skills are being tested
  • What are the language skills of the audience
  • Gender and cultural issues
  • Avoid grammar language and question structures that might provide clues
Enter the question stem. The quest should be clear and unambiguous. Avoid negative premises as these can tend to be ambiguous.

When building an MCQ consider the following:
  • Use phrases that learners are familiar with and have encountered in their study
  • Keep responses concise
  • There should be some consistency between the stem and the responses
  • Provide enough options to challenge learners to think about their response
  • Try to make sure that correct responses are not more detailed than the distractors
  • Distractors should be incorrect but plausible
Enter the question stem. The quest should be clear and unambiguous. Avoid negative premises as these can tend to be ambiguous.

Section B

Observe the pictures and put the sentences in order.

  • ​​You can see the Tower of Pisa, the Tuscan Natural Park and shopped in luxury shopping centres in Italy.
  • In Scotland you can see amazing castles and cathedrals. You can experience its local festival, the Fringe Festival.
  • In Spain, you can have a swim on its beautiful beaches. You can visit several aquariums.
  • You can experience All Souls’ Day, St John’s Day and the Holy Week.

Check

ACTIVITY 2: Listen and answer True-False Questions
Provide instruction on how the True/False Question should be completed.
University of Auckland
Enter any feedback you wish to provide to the learner. This field may be left blank. if this field is left blank default feedback will be provided.
A hint may be provided to assist the learner in answering the question.

True/false questions present a statement where the learner must decide if the statement is true. This type of question works well for factual information and information that lends itself to either/or responses.
Type the question stem. The question should be clear and unambiguous. Avoid negative premises as these can tend to be ambiguous.
True-False Question
Escriba la pregunta. La pregunta debe ser clara y no ambigua. Evite las premisas negativas ya que esta tienden a ser ambiguas.
Did Sarah visit Malaga on Thursday?

Introduzca la retroalimentación que quiere que vean los estudiantes después de haber intentado completar la actividad. Este campo se puede dejar vacío. Si este campo está vacío se ofrecerá la retroalimentación por defecto.
She visited Granada on Thursday
Se puede proporcionar una pista para ayudar al estudiante a responder la pregunta.
Escriba la pregunta. La pregunta debe ser clara y no ambigua. Evite las premisas negativas ya que esta tienden a ser ambiguas.
Did she go to the beach?

Introduzca la retroalimentación que quiere que vean los estudiantes después de haber intentado completar la actividad. Este campo se puede dejar vacío. Si este campo está vacío se ofrecerá la retroalimentación por defecto.
Their parents went to the beach
Se puede proporcionar una pista para ayudar al estudiante a responder la pregunta.
Escriba la pregunta. La pregunta debe ser clara y no ambigua. Evite las premisas negativas ya que esta tienden a ser ambiguas.
Did she like Holy Week?

Look at the pictures and filling the gap
University of Auckland
If this option is checked, submitted answers with different capitalization will be marked as incorrect.

port           bridge

      funfair                        Bull ring
If this option is set, each word will be marked as the learner types it rather than all the words being marked the end of the exercise.

Enter the text for the cloze activity in to the cloze field by either pasting text from another source or by typing text directly into the field.

To select words to hide, double click on the word to select it and click on the Hide/Show Word button below.

More than one possible answer can be defined enclosing them with pipes (|). I.e.: |dog|cat|bird|

If left unchecked a small number of spelling and capitalization errors will be accepted. If checked only an exact match in spelling and capitalization will be accepted.

For example: If the correct answer is Elephant then both elephant and Eliphant will be judged "close enough" by the algorithm as it only has one letter wrong, even if "Check Capitalization" is on.

If capitalization checking is off in the above example, the lowercase e will not be considered a mistake and eliphant will also be accepted.

If both "Strict Marking" and "Check Capitalization" are set, the only correct answer is "Elephant". If only "Strict Marking" is checked and "Check Capitalization" is not, "elephant" will also be accepted.

port           bridge

      funfair                        Bull ring
Bull ring

Cloze exercises are texts or sentences where students must fill in missing words. They are often used for the following purposes:

  1. To check knowledge of core course concepts (this could be a pre-check, formative exercise, or summative check).
  2. To check reading comprehension.
  3. To check vocabulary knowledge.
  4. To check word formation and/or grammatical competence.

If your goal is to test understanding of core concepts or reading comprehension

Write a summary of the concept or reading long enough to adequately test the target's knowledge, but short enough not to induce fatigue. Less than one typed page is probably adequate, but probably considerably less for young students or beginners.

Select words in the text thatare key to understanding the concepts. Thesewill probably be verbs, nouns, and key adverbs.Choose alternatives with one clear answer.

If your goal is to test vocabulary knowledge

Write a text using the target vocabulary. This text should be coherent and cohesive, and be of an appropriate length. Highlight the target words in the text. Choose alternatives with one clear answer.

If your goal is to test word formation/grammar:

Write a text using the target forms. This text should be coherent and cohesive, and be of an appropriate length. Remember that the goal is not vocabulary knowledge, so the core meanings of the stem words should be well known to the students.

Highlight the target words in the text. Provide alternatives with the same word stem, but different affixes. It is a good idea to get a colleague to test the test/exercise to make sure there are no surprises!
Cloze Activity
Enter any feedback you wish to provide the learner with-in the feedback field. This field can be left blank.
EXTRA ACTIVITIES

Hello guys!

You are doing great!

It is time to remember some vocabulary related to places, monuments, important people and festivities.

Are you ready, tour guide? Come on!

Tour guide

Definition:

Is the person who accompanies tourists on visits to a place.

Es la persona que acompaña a los turistas en las visitas a un lugar.

Example:

Our tour guide knew the best corners of the town.

Nuestro guía turístico conocía los mejores rincones del pueblo.

Spanish word:

Guía turístico

Contenido.

Lectura facilitada

Easy to read

Read

Now remember words related to culture

Ahora recuerda palabras relacionadas con la cultura.

Work on your own.

Trabaja tú solo.

Choose the option you prefer.

Elige la opción que prefieras.

EXTRA REINFORCEMENT 1:
Provide instruction on how the cloze activity should be completed. Default text will be entered if there are no changes to this field.
Read the paragraph below and fill in with the following words: attraction, windsurfing, port, beaches, city, Saint John, bullring, churches, fun fair.
University of Auckland
If this option is checked, submitted answers with different capitalization will be marked as incorrect.

Algeciras is a city in the south of Andalucía. There are some churches , like Nuestra señora de la Palma and Nuestra señora del Carmen. Algeciras has an important port near the sea. In summer, you can enjoy beautiful beaches like Rinoncillo and getares, in the latter you can go windsurfing . In June, the festival of Saint John is celebrated, also you can visit the Royal Fun fair , which includes attractions like amusement rides and different booths. Tourists can go  a bullfight at the bullring .
If this option is set, each word will be marked as the learner types it rather than all the words being marked the end of the exercise.

More than one possible answer can be defined enclosing them with pipes (|). I.e.: |dog|cat|bird|

If left unchecked a small number of spelling and capitalization errors will be accepted. If checked only an exact match in spelling and capitalization will be accepted.

For example: If the correct answer is Elephant then both elephant and Eliphant will be judged "close enough" by the algorithm as it only has one letter wrong, even if "Check Capitalization" is on.

If capitalization checking is off in the above example, the lowercase e will not be considered a mistake and eliphant will also be accepted.

If both "Strict Marking" and "Check Capitalization" are set, the only correct answer is "Elephant". If only "Strict Marking" is checked and "Check Capitalization" is not, "elephant" will also be accepted.

In June, the festival of Saint John is celebrated, also you can visit the Royal Fun fair , which includes attractions like amusement rides and different booths. Tourists can go  a bullfight at the bullring .

Cloze exercises are texts or sentences where students must fill in missing words. They are often used for the following purposes:

  1. To check knowledge of core course concepts (this could be a pre-check, formative exercise, or summative check).
  2. To check reading comprehension.
  3. To check vocabulary knowledge.
  4. To check word formation and/or grammatical competence.

If your goal is to test understanding of core concepts or reading comprehension

Write a summary of the concept or reading long enough to adequately test the target's knowledge, but short enough not to induce fatigue. Less than one typed page is probably adequate, but probably considerably less for young students or beginners.

Select words in the text thatare key to understanding the concepts. Thesewill probably be verbs, nouns, and key adverbs.Choose alternatives with one clear answer.

If your goal is to test vocabulary knowledge

Write a text using the target vocabulary. This text should be coherent and cohesive, and be of an appropriate length. Highlight the target words in the text. Choose alternatives with one clear answer.

If your goal is to test word formation/grammar:

Write a text using the target forms. This text should be coherent and cohesive, and be of an appropriate length. Remember that the goal is not vocabulary knowledge, so the core meanings of the stem words should be well known to the students.

Highlight the target words in the text. Provide alternatives with the same word stem, but different affixes. It is a good idea to get a colleague to test the test/exercise to make sure there are no surprises!

Although more often used in formal testing situations MCQs can be used as a testing tool to stimulate thought and discussion on topics students may feel a little reticent in responding to. When designing a MCQ test consider the following:
  • What learning outcomes are the questions testing
  • What intellectual skills are being tested
  • What are the language skills of the audience
  • Gender and cultural issues
  • Avoid grammar language and question structures that might provide clues
Enter the question stem. The quest should be clear and unambiguous. Avoid negative premises as these can tend to be ambiguous.

When building an MCQ consider the following:
  • Use phrases that learners are familiar with and have encountered in their study
  • Keep responses concise
  • There should be some consistency between the stem and the responses
  • Provide enough options to challenge learners to think about their response
  • Try to make sure that correct responses are not more detailed than the distractors
  • Distractors should be incorrect but plausible
Enter the question stem. The quest should be clear and unambiguous. Avoid negative premises as these can tend to be ambiguous.

Persona que elabora el contenido

Angela María Rodríguez Revidiego,
Descripción,

Este REA, está pensado para un Plan Educativo de Idioma Extranjero Inglés, nivel medio. Está formado por contenidos y actividades interactivas, que tratan todas las destrezas de habla inglesa, sobre el tema Your home.

 Está basado en la reedición del REA, The place where I live in,  cuyo enlace adjunto : https://edea.juntadeandalucia.es/bancorecursos/file/1bdeae40-0d7d-4218-b672-7bd2461ff68d/1/The%20place%20where%20I%20live%20in%20(REA%20DEL%20ALUMNADO%20HTML).zip/index.html. cuyos créditos figuran a continuación.
Título The place where I live in
Descripción Este REA está pensado para 5.º curso de Educación Primaria para el aprendizaje del inglés como primera lengua extranjera. Usando estos materiales, los estudiantes serán capaces de reconocer los elementos culturales más destacados del lugar donde viven para así poder darlos a conocer. La tarea final consistirá en la creación de un folleto digital informativo que recoja lugares, monumentos, festividades y personalidades importantes de su lugar de origen. Para finalizar, el folleto será enviado por correo electrónico como carta de presentación a un supuesto estudiante extranjero de acogida.
Persona elaboradora de contenido Jorge Merino Carmena
Persona elaboradora de contenido Piedad Cañas Cañas
Persona elaboradora de contenido Susana Moreno Gómez
Persona de soporte técnico José Gaspar Moreno Granada
Persona coordinadora del ciclo Jorge Merino Carmena
Persona coordinadora de materia Rosario Reyes Márquez
Organización Dirección General de Tecnologías Avanzadas y Transformación Educativa. Consejería de Desarrollo Educativo y Formación Profesional. Junta de Andalucía.
Licencia Licencia Creative Commons Reconocimiento No comercial Compartir igual 4.0

Text and Tasks
Aquí tienes el archivo fuente para editar este REA

• Este REA se ha publicado bajo Licencia Creative Commons Reconocimiento No comercial Compartir igual 4.0
  • Esto significa que tienes la posibilidad de poder usarlo, descargarlo, redistribuirlo y modificarlo para adaptarlo a tus necesidades.
  • Sigue estos pasos para usar/redistribuir/modificar este REA:

1. Descarga el archivo fuente. Con esto tienes el recurso original en formato editable.

2. Modifícalo usando eXeLearning.

3. Si aun no lo tienes, descarga e instala el estilo EducaAnd.

4. Si lo modificas, has de reconocer la autoría y publicarlo con la misma licencia (CC BY-SA-NC).

Puedes usar esta cita para referenciarlo:

Este REA es una adaptación del recurso original "Crea tu REA con calidad: guía para personas elaboradoras" del Proyecto REA Andalucía de la Consejería de Desarrollo Educativo y Formación Profesional de la Junta de Andalucía, que lo distribuye bajo licencia de CC BY-SA-NC.

Este REA, está pensado para un Plan Educativo de Idioma Extranjero Inglés, nivel medio. Está formado por contenidos y actividades interactivas, que tratan todas las destrezas de habla inglesa, sobre el tema Your home.

string.value: This OER is intended for the 5th grade of Primary Education students for the subject English as a first foreign language. Using these materials, students will be able to recognise the most important cultural elements of the place where they live in order to make them known. The final task will be to create an informative digital booklet that includes important places, monuments and personalities of their place of origin. Finally, this will be sent by e-mail as a letter of introduction to a supposed foreign host student.

This OER is intended for the 5th grade of Primary Education students for the subject English as a first foreign language. Using these materials, students will be able to recognise the most important cultural elements of the place where they live in order to make them known. The final task will be to create an informative digital booklet that includes important places, monuments and personalities of their place of origin. Finally, this will be sent by e-mail as a letter of introduction to a supposed foreign host student.
